channel.title: Is renaming the name of scar app necessary?
channel.description: Ok... the subject question is not clear... but i want to ask... i've looked through a couple of scripts... and some of them had a similar function to this: loadinclude('iTunes') which basically renamed the SCAR app you were running it in, into "iTunes". instead of the usual "scriptname - SCAR 2.03 by Katnieks"... so i was wondering does it serve any purpose... like antiban prevention (don't know how that would work tho...) or is it just a useless gimmick (which is what i think it is). thanks

item.title: Is renaming the name of scar app necessary?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

you can also minimize to tray or something so it doesnt appears in the bar below where i dont know the name of anymore

Read full topic

item.title: Is renaming the name of scar app necessary?
item.dc:creator: @Starblaster100 Starblaster100
item.description:
@Starblaster100 wrote:

and how many war3 users do you think run scar?

Renaming it is not neccessary. If it was, we would all be banned. Run a SRL script and see what it says…

Script powered by SRL Ver …

Its proven that Jagex know about SRL. IF they could see what other processes we were running we would all be banned

Read full topic
item.source: Is renaming the name of scar app necessary?

item.title: Is renaming the name of scar app necessary?
item.dc:creator: @phonnygoblin phonnygoblin
item.description:
@phonnygoblin wrote:

[quote=“Starblaster100, post:8, topic:8381”]its not neccessary at all
It just looks cool ;)[/quote]
wrong sorry but scar is also used in other games where they can see what other programs you are using. Like War3 for an autotalker/bot

Read full topic
item.source: Is renaming the name of scar app necessary?

item.title: Is renaming the name of scar app necessary?
item.dc:creator: @Flyboy Flyboy
item.description:
@Flyboy wrote:

I’ve heard some convincing arguments showing that a java based program could “see” what the names of the other progams running were, however a lot of very smart people have investigated the RS client and determinied it is safe and does not look or report what other programs are running. Personaly I would always change the name just to be on the safe side… just in case the latest client update includes something a little more sinister than the past ones.

Read full topic
item.source: Is renaming the name of scar app necessary?

item.title: Is renaming the name of scar app necessary?
item.dc:creator: @saltnpepper saltnpepper
item.description:
@saltnpepper wrote:

Ok… the subject question is not clear…
but i want to ask… i’ve looked through a couple of scripts… and some of them had a similar function to this:
loadinclude(‘iTunes’)
which basically renamed the SCAR app you were running it in, into “iTunes”. instead of the usual “scriptname - SCAR 2.03 by Katnieks”…
so i was wondering does it serve any purpose… like antiban prevention (don’t know how that would work tho…) or is it just a useless gimmick (which is what i think it is).
thanks
